description.narrative: This activity (Rohingya refugee influx response- Bangladesh 2017) is a component of Strengthening humanitarian preparedness and response in Bangladesh reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Multilateral organisation' and a budget of £52,691,838. This component benefits Bangladesh, and works in the following sector(s): Ending violence against women and girls, Material relief assistance and services . , with the following implementing partners: British Red Cross, CANADEM, Crown Agents Limited, Emirates SkyCargo, International Committee of the Red Cross, International Rescue Committee (UK), Merseyside Fire and Rescue Authority, Palladium International Ltd (UK), RedR, UK-Med, United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS). The start date is 18-09-2017 and the end date is 31-03-2021.

participating-org.narrative: International Committee of the Red Cross
United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS)
